text: (Draught) Pours a lightly hazy pale yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma of mango, citrus, pineapple, and peach. Flavor of grass, pine, citrus, peach with a dry, bitter finish.

On tap at Capones. Poured an opaque, golden color with a low bubbly, white head. Aromas of lemongrass and peppery spice, as well as cedar and pine notes. Flavors are lemon on the backbone, with cedar overtones leading to a very bitter, tangy aftertaste. The citrus notes overpower a bit on the palate. The finish is tangy, spiced, and slightly drying. Lighter body with moderate carbonation.

Bottle 22fl.oz.Light unclear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grass, lime. Quit refreshing. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, peel bitter, citrus, lime. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130225]
xvii seventeen. cloudy yellow, small white head. flavor is really sweet, grapefruit, very nice. aroma is quite hoppy.

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Heavy hoppy aroma; lemon, soap, light flowery or some spice I cant pinpoint, pale malt. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Medium bitter and dry finish with citrus. Crisp and refreshing.
Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Cloudy yellow - white head. Cedar, white peppery, fruity, sharpness, citrus, nice bitterness, ok hoppy, light malty, grape fruits, citrus, peachy.

Draft at Capone?s. Pours a hazy yellow with a slight white head. Aroma is strong grapefruit with lots of dankness. Taste is very interesting. Dank hops mix with grapefruit characters to give a really strong, deep flavor. Crushingly dry which I attribute to the lager yeast. Really weird but really good.
Botella. Hazy golden colour, small white head. Pleasant sweet herbal fruitish aroma. Good mouthfeel. Sweet herbal / spice malty fruitish flavour, good bitterness.

Draft at Capones.  Pours turbid margarita golden colored with white clingy head.  Nose was dry, flora, with a lot of pineapple.  Tasted resiny hoppy, dry and floral, with a lot of pineapple and grapefruity hints, and some finishing oaky woody notes that melded well into the beer.
Lätt grumligt ljusgul i färgen med litet vitt skum. Doftar funky, omogen ananas, grön ung humle, jäst och vinöst. Smakar bäskt av humle, torrt, gräs, ananas, aparikos, apelsinbitterhet.
22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and peachy. Grapefruity, peachy and light citrusy. Smooth peachy and crisp hops finish.
Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of hops, fruits, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, malt, and citrus fruits, leading to a bitter finish.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2014 Bottle, 22 oz, courtesy of Ungstrup. Hazy golden, small white head. Fresh, fruity nose with strong herbal notes. Fruity hoppy palate, clear plain malt bill. Nice, lingering bitter finish. Delicious.

Bottled. Yellow coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma: Sweeness, perfume, flowers, spice, herbs. Flavours: Herbs, flowers, sweetness, spice, caramel. Medium bodied. ends sweet and flowery bitter.

Bottle 65 cl. Courtesy of Pinball. Pours golden with a slight haze and a lacing white head. Hoppy, citrusy nose. Rich, malty body, thick and herbal citrus hops with a bitter finish - very bitter. 250213
On tap at Capone's. Cloudy straw with an averaged sized head. Floral, citrus, with straw and grass. Some toastiness.

Draft at Capones. Pours a cloudy light yellow with fluffy white head and great lacing. Notes of pine, lemon, citrus, onion. Somewhat sweet up front with a bitter earthy lemon finish. More akin to an IPA than a lager but very good none the less.

On tap at the Cask Republic. Aroma glistens with hop oils, fresh and if I had to guess in the Nelson Sauvin or Galaxy. It had that pungent white wine and pale citrus quality. The extra-strong hop nose lessens a bit in the flavor realm, but holds on to a nicely terse and biting grassiness. The bummer here is that anything "lager" is obliviated by the intense dry-hopping, which puts this beer out of balance a little.
